article.para: This section contains information about changing the look and behaviour of your computer to suit your preference.

para.ulink: Customising other aspects of the desktop

sect1.title: Using KDE or Xfce instead of the GNOME desktop
sect1.para: This topic provides instructions on how to install and use a desktop other than the default GNOME desktop, such as KDE or Xfce.

sect2.title: Installing a KDE desktop
sect2.para: KDE is a popular, fully-featured desktop environment. Kubuntu is a version of Ubuntu which uses the KDE desktop.

step.para: Click the User Switcher in the top right hand corner of the screen and then press Log out to log out of Ubuntu
At the log-in screen which appears, press OptionsSelect Session...
Choose the KDE option and press Change Session
Enter your username and password as normal. KDE should then start.

sect2.title: Installing an Xfce desktop
sect2.para: Xfce is a desktop environment which is designed to be fast and lightweight. Xubuntu is a version of Ubuntu which uses the Xfce desktop.

step.para: Click the User Switcher in the top right hand corner of the screen and then press Log out to log out of Ubuntu
At the log-in screen which appears, press OptionsSelect Session...
Choose the Xfce option and press Change Session
Enter your username and password as normal. Xfce should then start.
